pages.text:
Many variants can only be obtained through mutation, caused by allowing a grape bush to grow diagonally to another mature bush.

Cross-breeding different grape bushes will result in a new variant, for example breeding to Pinot Noir bushes will produce a Pinot Grigio bush.

A select few variants of grapes require special conditions or a non-grape parent to be created, and special breeds require these unique grapes as parents themselves!

Both the delicious Koshu and devilish Pinot De L'Enfer fit into this category of specialty breeds, and it really shows in their flavour.

pages.name: Pollination
pages.text: If you would like to increase the chances of mutation, ensure to place a beehive nearby to your growth area!
